name: Harbourside Apartments

reviews.text: we stayed at the harbourside apartments for 4 days the apartments were spotless and very close to ferry which made it easy to get back and forth for sightseeing we found the staff very friendly and helpful would stay there again if in sydney
reviews.title: the view was amazing

reviews.text: I was lucky enogh live in Mc Mahons point for a few years. So when we made time for a vist to our old stomping ground I knew the location I wanted. However I have heard from other locals that these apartmnts can be a hit an miss. I was lucky and got a hit. My Lavender bay apartment was great. Sitting on our couch I could see the bridge an opera house so we where very happy-Very clean and the one bedroom works great if you have kids. Tuck them into bed and order some Blue ginger (local lndian) a bottle (or two) of nice red and life is good. Staff seemed good . Stayed 3 nights and was worth every cent.
reviews.title: Ex local.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartments are a bit old-skool and a little rough around the edges here and there, but that just made them feel more homely in my books. Sterile, bland hotel rooms don't actually do that much for me. Seen one; seen them all.
reviews.title: Nice Apartments in an Awesome Spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position of Harbourside Apartments can't be beaten. Although we booked what was described as a room with a Lavender Bay view, we had a great view of the Harbour Bridge (maybe we got upgraded). What an amazing view to wake up to! Truly spectacular at 6am (I was on NZ time!)
reviews.title: who needs t.v when you can watch the harbour

reviews.text: I walked over the Harbour Bridge into the city one day. This was QUITE a walk, but doable, with several coffee stops along the way. On the way home, the ferry delivered me practically at the door of the hotel. Perfect.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We have stayed at Harbourside many times over about 15 years. It remains our first choice for Sydney (although, to be honest, we are so satisfied with Harbourside that we haven't stayed anywhere else in Sydney for some time - but comparing prices and locations and facilities it still seems to be good value). We were there for a week in October 2010 and again for 4 nights in November, in studio apartments with harbour view. The apartments with view are a must really - the perfect view of the harbour, Bridge and Opera House (although best views are from below about floor 13, because from greater height the Bridge deck starts to chop off the top of the OHouse, quite spoiling one's photos). We have always found the staff helpful, although the quality of help and interaction can be variable. The general standard of H'side sometimes shows its age, but apartments are constantly upgraded, and both the ones we had were modern, new and clean. Each has a small kitchen, basically equipped, and there are laundry facilities on alternate floors. There's Sails restaurant right outside the door, and Blues Point Road is a 5-minute walk away (up-hill) with delis and minimarkets, post office, hairdressers, wineshops and other shops, many restaurants (try Delicado) and two pubs. The bus from just outside H'side will take you up there, or a bit further on to North Sydney with all shops and facilities you could want. So you can eat out or shop and cook in the apartment - or on the poolside BBQ. All in all, it seems difficult to beat, and several friends to whom we have recommended H'side agree. (Oh, and come on, Andrew from Shoreham, please let's not have everywhere in the world airconditioned! There's usually plenty of air movement through the windows.) (And come on, Harbourside - $22 for 24 hours Internet is ludicrously expensive!)
reviews.title: Difficult to beat

reviews.text: On emigrating to Sydney, our first impression was built on the extremely unfriendly and un-customer service oriented staff at Harbourside Apartments. We were treated with disdain even though we spent over $10,000 there. We couldnt leave soon enough. in short the rooms are overpriced, the overall service terrible and there was no value for money. The only advantage is it proximity to the ferry, but there are plenty of other serviced apartments in Kiribili which would have to be better.
reviews.title: Dont stay at Harbourside Apartments when emigrating to Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi, I have just returned to Melbourne from our first trip to Sydney and my husband and I highly recommend this hotel. The staff were lovely and nothing was too much trouble for them. We arrived early and the staff looked after our bags all day before we arrived back later just before dinner, again on the last day we were able to leave the bags all day. The rooms are clean and comfortable and have everything you need. Homemade muffins on the way out each morning were both a delight and much appreciated. It is obvious that the drawcard of this hotel is the view - it is simply spectacular both day and night. The location is also a plus especially if you dont have a car - you are metres away from a jetty where ferrys frequently dock well into the evening and go to all tourist spots as well as circular quay which will allow you to catch other ferries, or buses or trains to anywhere you pleased. We loved our time at Harrbouside and will be recommending it to others for sure.
reviews.title: View, location and ambiance, what more do you want?

reviews.text: I stayed at the Harbourside for three nights when my regular North Sydney accommodation was booked out (quite common in this part of town at certain times of the year). Wanting to be close to work, I tried the Harbourside Apartments and didn't regret my choice.
reviews.title: What a View!

reviews.text: Other reviewers have pointed out that the apartment quality can be hit-and-miss. I was very happy with the ground floor apartment I was given. It was to the side of the complex, so I was able to enter from street level and not reception.
reviews.title: Basic but Clean with Great Views

reviews.text: Had a great 2 night stay in this hotel. The location is absolutely fanastic bring situated on the end of Blues Point. The views, WOW. From my room I could see the entire Harbour Bridge and OPera HOuse, city skyline, and Luna pArk tyo the left. Being situated right on the waters edge is a huge plus. Ferry is at your door: 7 minutes to Circular Quay.
reviews.title: Best view ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were an absolute treat, always smiling and very helpful. Pity the reviewer from Dublin criticised the staff as all my interactions with the front desk were pleasant and professional. Liked that the apartments had a more "at home feel" rather than a Hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location with Service to Match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great selection of cafes up around the corner. Pool right on the waters edge (complete with the picture postcard perfect view), free parking for guests (great for me).
reviews.title: Unbeatable views, superb location

reviews.text: Oh, forgot to mention price - Excellent considering location, view and room condition.
reviews.title: Rude staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked it so much I'm already planning anothe short break to Sydney soon.
reviews.title: Superb View!

reviews.text: No air conditioning in Sydney in January is not on. For A$520 per night for a very small 2
reviews.title: NO AIR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bedroom apartment with a nightmare carpark unhelpful staff is overpriced, even if the view is great. to be told that because the website does not list air conditioning we should not expect is beyond belief. After all it is 2010.
reviews.title: ungracious receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a long flight from USA. We happened to strike a very unfriendly, ungracious and very unhelpful receptionist. It was an unfortunate start to our stay. The apartment we had was great but her behaviour has coloured our views of the accommodation. We have put our complaints to the management and had a helpful reply but staff like that should never be tolerated.
reviews.title: The Best View for the Best Price

reviews.text: This Apartment was all about the view. If you want a good view then this is the best deal. The apartment was great, very clean and professional. They provided tea, biscuits, fresh towels, and sheets. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: lovely apartment with amazing vue's

reviews.text: Best of all this place is located in north Sydney. You get a great view of the bridge, opera house, lavender bay, and luna park. If you do not like the craziness and noise of the city then this is the place for you. I would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Unforgettable

description: The panoramic harbour views from Harbourside Apartments set this property apart while offering the exclusivity of a waterfront address right on the edge of Sydney Harbour. Sydney CBD and Darling Harbour are accessed peacefully and quickly without fuss by ferry from McMahons Point wharf at the end of the driveway. Harbourside offers studio, one and two bedroom Apartments furnished in a modern contemporary style. Harbourside Apartments are serviced daily with free car parking for guests.
